description: Users experiencing issues with Windows Secure Boot, specifically related to KB5025885, may need to perform a set of eight reboots as part of the remediation process. This includes two reboots to install an updated certificate, two for updating the boot manager, two to enable revocation, and two additional reboots for the SVN update. This symptom could present significant downtime for users, as the multiple reboots disrupt normal operations. The associated CVE identifier for these issues is CVE-2023-24932, underlining the importance of staying updated with the latest Microsoft patches to mitigate potential risks. System administrators should closely monitor their environments following the application of the updates to ensure that the Secure Boot process stabilizes after the reboots.
